content:
I just got this message at the end of my build:
"Note that this IG has not been built in a fashion suitable for publication (consult Confluence for publishing advice if you are actually building with intent to publish)"

What page is it referring to?

@Grahame Grieve A URL would be nice. Also, I've had others freak out about the message. Perhaps reword it as "Published as a continuous integration snapshot. To publish this IG with the redirects and other files necessary for a final publication, refer to the documentation at ..."
Yes, please! THat is a much better message
it's not a CI build, it's your local build
what about this message freaks people out?
Okay, still would like a URL as part of the message and what "not suitable for publishing" means
well, there isn't a URL yet. Work in progress.
not suitable for publishing means just that...
Maybe a list or example of what is different from publishable version or something so that I know that it only means this is a local build
From most people's perspective, CI build is publishing. The current message makes it sound like they've messed something up or broken a rule.
If it's better to say "Published as a local build snapshot", that's fine.

FWIW - I want to echo what Lloyd said. I did read it to mean "there is something wrong with your IG and it will not get published until you fix something" but then I had no idea what was wrong. It was not obvious to me that it meant it was just a local build, and hence this specific instance wasn't suitable for publishing.

In retrospect, I can see I read too much into the message, but it still caught me very off guard. Perhaps I missed an announcement about why this message was introduced?
there was no announcement, because in fact, I fixed a bug that meant this message wasn't consistently showing. it's been there a long time.
